update.description:
This patch removes the <gdal/ from all the #includes that are including GDAL headers, as well as adds 'include_directories(${GDAL_INCLUDE_DIR})' to the root CMakeLists.txt

As mentioned in the commit message, I would have put this in a lower level CMakeLists.txt, but the build would not properly parallelize for some reason.

I belive this could also fix issue 1063, related to build problems on Mac OS X where GDAL was detected but headers could not be found.
update.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

content.raw: I find the [meld](http://meldmerge.org/) tool to be very useful for resolving conflicts. Install meld and set the environment variable `HGMERGE=meld` before the `hg merge` command, and it will open the meld window. The make the appropriate changes so that the content in all three panes is the same, hit save, and exit.
content.html: I find the meld tool to be very useful for resolving conflicts. Install meld and set the environment variable HGMERGE=meld before the hg merge command, and it will open the meld window. The make the appropriate changes so that the content in all three panes is the same, hit save, and exit.

content.raw:
Do you need help with resolving the conflicts?
~~~
hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo
hg up default
hg merge
# then resolve conflicts
hg com -m "merge"
hg push
~~~
content.html:
Do you need help with resolving the conflicts?

hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo
hg up default
hg merge
# then resolve conflicts
hg com -m "merge"
hg push

content.raw:
here's a better patch:
~~~
diff -r 51fe9298e09b gazebo/common/Dem.hh
--- a/gazebo/common/Dem.hh	Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/gazebo/common/Dem.hh	Mon Jan 19 18:39:52 2015 -0800
@@ -22,7 +22,6 @@
 #include <gazebo/util/system.hh>
 
 #ifdef HAVE_GDAL
-# include <gdal/gdal_priv.h>
 # include <string>
 # include <vector>
 
diff -r 51fe9298e09b gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc	Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc	Mon Jan 19 18:39:52 2015 -0800
@@ -22,7 +22,8 @@
 #include <gazebo/gazebo_config.h>
 
 #ifdef HAVE_GDAL
-# include <gdal/gdalwarper.h>
+# include <gdalwarper.h>
+# include <gdal_priv.h>
 #endif
 
 #include <algorithm>
~~~
content.html:
here's a better patch:

diff -r 51fe9298e09b gazebo/common/Dem.hh
--- a/gazebo/common/Dem.hh  Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/gazebo/common/Dem.hh  Mon Jan 19 18:39:52 2015 -0800
@@ -22,7 +22,6 @@
 #include <gazebo/util/system.hh>

 #ifdef HAVE_GDAL
-# include <gdal/gdal_priv.h>
 # include <string>
 # include <vector>

diff -r 51fe9298e09b gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc  Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc  Mon Jan 19 18:39:52 2015 -0800
@@ -22,7 +22,8 @@
 #include <gazebo/gazebo_config.h>

 #ifdef HAVE_GDAL
-# include <gdal/gdalwarper.h>
+# include <gdalwarper.h>
+# include <gdal_priv.h>
 #endif

 #include <algorithm>

pull_request.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

pullrequest.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

content.raw:
The following fixes the examples using cmake `find_package`:
~~~
diff -r 51fe9298e09b CMakeLists.txt
--- a/CMakeLists.txt	Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Jan 19 18:11:53 2015 -0800
@@ -369,6 +369,9 @@
   endif()
 
   set(PKG_DEPENDS Boost Protobuf SDFormat OGRE)
+  if (HAVE_GDAL)
+    set(PKG_DEPENDS ${PKG_DEPENDS} GDAL)
+  endif()
 
   set(cmake_conf_file "cmake/gazebo-config.cmake")
   set(cmake_conf_version_file "cmake/gazebo-config-version.cmake")
~~~
but the pkg-config tests still fail. [gdal added a .pc file in 1.11.0](https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/ticket/3470), but that doesn't help trusty.

Note that this a blocking problem since it can cause downstream build failures.
content.html:
The following fixes the examples using cmake find_package:

diff -r 51fe9298e09b CMakeLists.txt
--- a/CMakeLists.txt    Fri Jan 16 16:51:46 2015 -0200
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt    Mon Jan 19 18:11:53 2015 -0800
@@ -369,6 +369,9 @@
   endif()

   set(PKG_DEPENDS Boost Protobuf SDFormat OGRE)
+  if (HAVE_GDAL)
+    set(PKG_DEPENDS ${PKG_DEPENDS} GDAL)
+  endif()

   set(cmake_conf_file "cmake/gazebo-config.cmake")
   set(cmake_conf_version_file "cmake/gazebo-config-version.cmake")

but the pkg-config tests still fail. gdal added a .pc file in 1.11.0, but that doesn't help trusty.

Note that this a blocking problem since it can cause downstream build failures.

pull_request.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

pullrequest.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

content.raw: There's also some [compiler warnings](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-external-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/15/warnings16Result/new/package.-831711382/) caused by the gdal headers. We suppress these types of warnings from ogre with [pragmas in an intermediate header file](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/fec8deb2ea062fd3bf06abce89144d97548dfc8a/gazebo/rendering/ogre_gazebo.h?at=default).
content.html: There's also some compiler warnings caused by the gdal headers. We suppress these types of warnings from ogre with pragmas in an intermediate header file.

pullrequest.title: Fix for properly including GDAL headers on non-ubuntu systems

content.raw:
Thanks very much Alec for your contribution. @scpeters, I've patched the continuous integration server to use gdal on every gazebo build.

@alectenharmsel: this changes is triggering some problems in the gazebo test suite. See [the jenkins log](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-external-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/15/consoleFull) and check for: `fatal error: gdal_priv.h: No such file or directory`. Could you try to solve them please? I can help if needed.
content.html:
Thanks very much Alec for your contribution. @scpeters, I've patched the continuous integration server to use gdal on every gazebo build.

@alectenharmsel: this changes is triggering some problems in the gazebo test suite. See the jenkins log and check for: fatal error: gdal_priv.h: No such file or directory. Could you try to solve them please? I can help if needed.
